body:
+1 when we vote the new rules?
regards.

it was here:
https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/f13ded1ff4b7a4b29d40236f7573953d5bf69ed55f80211f9bcead8f@%3Cdev.spot.apache.org%3E

For some reason this link it's pulling up the whole threat, but you should be able to see it

I just sent a follow up to the dev list just in case anyone has any issues with this.
We can have more discussion there if needed @solrac901
Is there a jira ticket created to track this change? If not can you created please and rename the title of the PR following the naming convention:  **SPOT-XX Title of the PR**
Is there a jira ticket created to track this change? If not can you created please and rename the title of the PR following the naming convention:  **SPOT-XX Title of the PR**
Is there a jira ticket created to track this change? If not can you created please and rename the title of the PR following the naming convention:  **SPOT-XX Title of the PR**

+1

Does it make sense to upgrade the code to work with the latest versions of graphql?
Is this tied to a jira already?
@natedogs911 yes its tied to SPOT-244

@castleguarders 
trying to catch these up,
do you have a jira already for this?

also I assume you've submitted an ICLA?
being it's not a significant body of code or an additional feature you may not need one but it's always nice to have it covered.

Hi @anilreddydonthireddy , @natedogs911 , @rabarona - a customer and I have been moving forward with ODM schemas, and the changes in this PR were very useful for us in getting the spot-ml process to work using ODM tables as the source.

I made a few small changes to get the code to compile and also fixed tests that were not working -
 those changes are here (also dropped the changes to spot-oa):  https://github.com/curtishoward/incubator-spot/tree/SPOT-180_supportHiveViews

@anilreddydonthireddy - would you be able to merge my changes into your PR, or should I create a new PR based on my version that I ended up using?
I'm closing this one as I've updated some things and included the changes in #134

I've opened [SPOT-253](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPOT-253)

Does someone want to own testing this?

Otherwise +1 from me

create [SPOT-254](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPOT-254)

+1
+1 thanks
+1 Thanks for the code docs
Thanks @anilreddydonthireddy  and @curtishoward interested to see what this allows
@rabarona can you review?

Hi guys,
As for the file `bluecoat.py`, it should be added the method `partitionBy` to correctly insert data into the Hive table. Otherwise, they are not accessible through Hive. Here is the change:

>  df.write.format('parquet').mode('append')**.partitionBy('y', 'm', 'd', 'h')**.insertInto(hive_table)
Good idea @ktzoulas. I modified the code to do it.

After merging the changes as part of PR. I am still getting the issue while running ML for proxy data.

18/06/20 07:45:16 INFO SuspiciousConnectsAnalysis: Running Spark LDA with params alpha = 1.02 beta = 1.001 Max iterations = 20 Optimizer = em
Exception in thread "main" java.util.NoSuchElementException: next on empty iterator
        at scala.collection.Iterator$$anon$2.next(Iterator.scala:39)
        at scala.collection.Iterator$$anon$2.next(Iterator.scala:37)
        at scala.collection.IndexedSeqLike$Elements.next(IndexedSeqLike.scala:63)
        at scala.collection.IterableLike$class.head(IterableLike.scala:107)
        at scala.collection.mutable.ArrayOps$ofRef.scala$collection$IndexedSeqOptimized$$super$head(ArrayOps.scala:186)
        at scala.collection.IndexedSeqOptimized$class.head(IndexedSeqOptimized.scala:126)
        at scala.collection.mutable.ArrayOps$ofRef.head(ArrayOps.scala:186)
        at org.apache.spark.mllib.clustering.EMLDAOptimizer.initialize(LDAOptimizer.scala:166)
        at org.apache.spark.mllib.clustering.EMLDAOptimizer.initialize(LDAOptimizer.scala:80)
        at org.apache.spark.mllib.clustering.LDA.run(LDA.scala:331)
        at org.apache.spot.lda.SpotLDAWrapper$.runLDA(SpotLDAWrapper.scala:132)
        at org.apache.spot.proxy.ProxySuspiciousConnectsModel$.trainModel(ProxySuspiciousConnectsModel.scala:155)
        at org.apache.spot.proxy.ProxySuspiciousConnectsAnalysis$.run(ProxySuspiciousConnectsAnalysis.scala:106)
        at org.apache.spot.SuspiciousConnects$.main(SuspiciousConnects.scala:112)
        at org.apache.spot.SuspiciousConnects.main(SuspiciousConnects.scala)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
        at org.apache.spark.deploy.SparkSubmit$.org$apache$spark$deploy$SparkSubmit$$runMain(SparkSubmit.scala:755)
        at org.apache.spark.deploy.SparkSubmit$.doRunMain$1(SparkSubmit.scala:180)

Hi and Thanks for the PR. 
Could you please open a [Jira ticket here](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SPOT/issues/SPOT-237?filter=allopenissues) and reference the Issue's key (SPOT-###) in the title.
Thanks!

Hi,
I already opened a Jira ticket, and now this PR reflects it as well.

Hello @gustavstickley 
Thank you for your contributions. In order to complete this Pull Request just a couple of things need to be completed.
1) Please open a Jira Issue [here](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SPOT/issues). Then add that to the title of this PR "[SPOT-###] Fix Low Hanging Fruit ..."
2) Please fix merge conflicts

Unfortunately if you do not complete this by 08/31 your pull request will be closed without merging.

Thank you again for your contribution.

Hello @kpeiruza 
Thank you for your contributions. In order to complete this Pull Request, please fix the conflicts

Hello @tpltnt 
Thank you for your contributions. In order to complete this Pull Request just a couple of things need to be completed.

Please open a Jira Issue [here](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SPOT/issues). 
Then add that to the title of this PR (e.g. "[SPOT-###] flexible path to...")

Unfortunately if you do not complete this by 08/31 your pull request will be closed without merging.

Thank you again for your contribution.

Hello @bjigmp 
Thank you for your contributions. In order to complete this Pull Request, please fix the conflicts.

Hello @ktzoulas 
Thank you for your contributions. In order to complete this Pull Request just a couple of things need to be completed.

1) Please open a Jira Issue [here](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SPOT/issues). 
2) Then add that to the title of this PR "[SPOT-###] Ingestion using..."

Thank you again for your contribution.

Hello @tpltnt
Thank you for your contributions. In order to complete this Pull Request just a couple of things need to be completed.

1) Please open a Jira Issue [here](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SPOT/issues).
2) Then add that to the title of this PR "[SPOT-###] DNSSuspiciousConnectsAnalysis..."

Thank you again for your contribution.

Hello @cgiraldo 
In order to continue, could you please fix your conflicts.
Thank you

Hello @Empty-S 
Thank you for your contributions. In order to complete this Pull Request just a couple of things need to be completed.

1) Please open a Jira Issue [here](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SPOT/issues).
2) Then add that to the title of this PR "[SPOT-###] Update sbt assembly"

Thank you again for your contribution.
@natedogs911 can you review this PR again and determine if any of these changes are already a part of the work you did with the hdfs_setup.sh script?
@natedogs911 can you put the jira ticket in the PR title as well?

I discovered a very similar problem to the previous one: the ml_ops.sh has two optional arguments: TOL and MAX_RESULTS, in this order, not the other way around (It is documented correctly in ML_OPS.md.)
I didn't open a new pull request or Jira ticket for it, I hope it is all right.

The file I have modified docs/open-data-model/open-data-model.md have been removed from the upstream branch. I opened a new pull request  #149 modifying the new file docs/open-data-model.md of the upstream branch.
I'll bring up that you made changes in the dev mailing list and see if it's alright to merge it anyway.

Thanks for opening a new PR with the conflicts fixed. 
Please create a new [Jira Issue here](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SPOT/issues) and I will be sure to bring it up in the next project meeting on 09/07 (_See Dev mailing list for more details_). 

If you can attend, that would be a great forum for you to get immediate feedback on your PR.

Hi @schonz ,
I ve just created a JIRA [ticket](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPOT-280).

Let me know if any further action is required!

Awesome, looks like the ASF bot has picked up the link.
For future reference Jira Issue is [SPOT-280]

Next steps is for you to promote your Jira Issue. 
We have a Project meeting every 2 weeks, next one is September 7 at 3:30 (ET); look at the Developer mailing list for details and make sure you sign up for it if you have not yet. All new Jira issues are discussed, so this is a great opportunity for you to go over what you have done here and get instant feedback from committers as well as their +1 blessing. 

Look forward to seeing you there.
@TaddWood added to my TODOs

@curtishoward this is really solid work.  The only barrier I see is that Envelope seems to have a hard requirement to use CDH.  Let me know if that's not the case.

## Requirements (From Envelope)

Envelope requires a CDH5.7+ cluster with:
- Cloudera's distribution of Apache Spark 2.2.0 Release 2 or above
- Cloudera's distribution of Apache Kafka 2.1.0 (based on Apache Kafka 0.10) or above, if using that component
- Cloudera's distribution of Apache Kudu 1.3.0 or above, if using that component
@TaddWood - thanks.  There are plans to eliminate the CDH dependencies, I'll check on the timeline for that and get back to you
Let's defer this PR until we have our next discussion about the future of the ODM.

jira created
https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SPOT/issues/SPOT-283?filter=allissues
Resolves https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPOT-284
Resolves https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPOT-285

+1 with a little hesitance about the confluence wiki as it's not quite bug free yet
But I think we need to fix the slack issue

@natedogs911 I agree this would be better implemented as a configuration option.

@rphi are you still interested in committing this?  If so let us know, and please open a new Jira Issue describing your enhancement/fix.
Yup, having this in a config option makes far more sense, I can add that into `ingest_conf.json`. I'll update this PR with the changes.
@rphi awesome!  If you access to the Spot Jira go ahead and add a ticket as well with some details on what this fix includes.  If not, let me know and I can open a ticket for you.
Hi @TaddWood - [Envelope 0.6.0](https://github.com/cloudera-labs/envelope) was released last week, and it now uses upstream Apache dependencies (rather than CDH services)
@curtishoward that's great news.  Does it make sense to create some configurations for the original Spot data models until we get a handle on the ODM?

Awesome contribution.  Can you talk a little bit more to the background/motivation or how someone should approach reviewing it?  I do see that the JIRA also mentions "As a user I want to ingest and use different data sources with Apache Spot using a predefined schema". Thanks

Hi @tzhou2018,
Are you attempting to resolve the JIRA Issue Spot-181 with this PR?

Hi @pdion891,
As a next step could you please open a ticket on the [Spot Jira](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SPOT/issues) and edit the title to the PR to include it. 
(e.g. [SPOT-###] Fix sudo command, add help, fix ShellCheck warnings)

Thanks,

Hi @schonz,  JIRA bug created, I cannot assigned the ticket to someone, but I cannot assign it to someone, anyway  I guest you will close the ticket at the next version ? 

Cheers,

Thanks for creating the ticket! You don't have to assign anyone to it. There's a bot that connects this PR to the Jira Ticket when you include the Jira Issue number in the title or as a comment. It's just part of our process.
Thank you for what you have done for Spot Schema.Can you send me some raw proxy data instances? I can't find any proxy data.

@tzhou2018 it appears that you might've committed your changes against the SPOT-181 branch, but the scope of your changes seem to be a bit smaller:

./ml_ops.sh 20181102 flow 5000 0.5
The order of the two parameters needs to be changed.

Can you confirm, and if so can you create a separate branch off of "master" for these changes as well as a JIRA ticket detailing the changes you're proposing with respect to the ml_ops.sh script?
Fixed a simple bug, there was a duplicate link to the confluence page on one of the menus. Also, added Node_Modules to .gitignore as is customary.
@schonz we should probably update the copyright dates as well, but we can move that into a separate PR for clarity sake.

It was already fixed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-spot/pull/134
Closed this PR

I think ML_score needs to be updated to ml_score in a few places, but looks good I think for the most part.  

+1
